patterns: What are the symptoms of covid
what happens when you get covid
responses: The most common symptoms of covid are fever, tiredness, and dry cough. Some patients may have aches and pains, nasal congestion, runny nose, sore throat or diarrhea. These symptoms are usually mild and begin gradually.

patterns: What are the symptoms of covid
do we get fever in covid
what happens if I get covid
responses: Some people become infected but don’t develop any symptoms and don't feel unwell. Most people (about 80%) recover from the disease without needing special treatment.

patterns: What are the symptoms of covid
responses: Around 1 out of every 6 people who gets covid becomes seriously ill and develops difficulty breathing.

patterns: What are the symptoms of covid
is fever a symptom of covid
Do old people get covid faster
responses: Older people, and those with underlying medical problems like high blood pressure, heart problems or diabetes, are more likely to develop serious illness. People with fever, cough and difficulty breathing should seek medical attention.

People can catch covid from others who have the virus. The disease can spread from person to person through small droplets from the nose or mouth which are spread when a person with covid coughs or exhales.

People can also catch covid if they breathe in droplets from a person with covid who coughs out or exhales droplets. This is why it is important to stay more than 1 meter (3 feet) away from a person who is sick.

patterns: Can the virus that causes covid be transmitted through the air
How does covid spread to people
responses: Studies to date suggest that the virus that causes covid is mainly transmitted through contact with respiratory droplets rather than through the air.

patterns: Can covid be caught from a person who has no symptoms
What is reason why covid spreads
responses: The main way the disease spreads is through respiratory droplets expelled by someone who is coughing. The risk of catching covid from someone with no symptoms at all is very low.

patterns: Can covid be caught from a person who has no symptoms
does everyone experience strong symptoms in covid
responses: Many people with covid experience only mild symptoms. This is particularly true at the early stages of the disease. It is therefore possible to catch covid from someone who has, for example, just a mild cough and does not feel ill.
A covid‑19 vaccine is a vaccine intended to provide acquired immunity against severe acute respiratory

Most people who get covid-19 will have a mild form of the illness and will be able to recover at home, without needing hospital treatment. Stay home and call your local health authority for advice if you have any symptoms of covid-19. If you have difficulty breathing, persistent pain in your chest or loss of speech or mobility, call your health provider straight away.

patterns: Can I catch covid from the feces of someone with the disease
responses: The risk of catching covid from the feces of an infected person appears to be low. While initial investigations suggest the virus may be present in feces in some cases, spread through this route is not a main feature of the outbreak.

patterns: what to do to remove germs from hands
What can I do to protect myself and prevent the spread of disease
responses: Regularly and thoroughly clean your hands with an alcohol-based hand rub or wash them with soap and water.

patterns: What can I do to protect myself and prevent the spread of disease
responses: Maintain at least 1 metre (3 feet) distance between yourself and anyone who is coughing or sneezing.

patterns: What can I do to protect myself and prevent the spread of disease
can i touch eyes without getting infected
can i tough mouth without getting infected
responses: Avoid touching eyes, nose and mouth.

patterns: What can I do to protect myself and prevent the spread of disease
responses: Make sure you, and the people around you, follow good respiratory hygiene. This means covering your mouth and nose with your bent elbow or tissue when you cough or sneeze. Then dispose of the used tissue immediately.

patterns: What can I do to protect myself and prevent the spread of disease
will quarantining help to stop covid
responses: Stay home if you feel unwell. If you have a fever, cough and difficulty breathing, seek medical attention and call in advance. Follow the directions of your local health authority.

patterns: What can I do to protect myself and prevent the spread of disease
responses: If possible, avoid traveling to places  – especially if you are an older person or have diabetes, heart or lung disease.

patterns: What can I do to protect myself and prevent the spread of disease
how to protect myself and others
responses: Keep up to date on the latest covid hotspots (cities or local areas where covid is spreading widely).

patterns: What can I do to protect myself andProtection measures for persons who are in or have recently visited (past 14 days) areas where covid is spreading prevent the spread of disease
what to do if i am first contact
what to do if i am near positive person
what to do if not well
how to protect ourself when sick
how to protect others when sick
responses: Self-isolate by staying at home if you begin to feel unwell, even with mild symptoms such as headache, low grade fever (37.3 C or above) and slight runny nose, until you recover.

patterns: Protection measures for persons who are in or have recently visited (past 14 days) areas where covid is spreading
what if we have breathing difficulty
what if its difficult to breathe
responses: If you develop fever, cough and difficulty breathing, seek medical advice promptly as this may be due to a respiratory infection or other serious condition. Call in advance and tell your provider of any recent travel or contact with travelers.

patterns: How likely am I to catch covid
how to check if i have covid
how to check if i am positive
how do we know we are positive
how to see if i have covid
how to check if someone has covid
how to know we have covid
responses: The risk depends on where you  are - and more specifically, whether there is a covid outbreak unfolding there.

patterns: How likely am I to catch covid
how to know if i am positive
responses: For most people in most locations the risk of catching covid is still low. However, there are now places around the world (cities or areas) where the disease is spreading. For people living in, or visiting, these areas the risk of catching covid is higher.

patterns: How likely am I to catch covid
what to do if there is an outbreak
responses: covid outbreaks can be contained and transmission stopped, as has been shown in China and some other countries. Unfortunately, new outbreaks can emerge rapidly. It’s important to be aware of the situation where you are or intend to go.

patterns: should i be scared of covid
responses: Illness due to covid infection is generally mild, especially for children and young adults. However, it can cause serious illness: about 1 in every 5 people who catch it need hospital care.
We can channel our concerns into actions to protect ourselves, our loved ones and our communities.

patterns: Who is at risk of developing severe illness
who are most likely to get covid
who are most likely to be infected
who all will get covid first
responses: While we are still learning about how covid-2019 affects people, older persons and persons with pre-existing medical conditions (such as high blood pressure, heart disease, lung disease, cancer or diabetes)  appear to develop serious illness more often than others.

patterns: Are antibiotics effective in preventing or treating the covid
should i take medicine to prevent covid
should i take medicine to cure covid
responses: No. Antibiotics do not work against viruses, they only work on bacterial infections. covid is caused by a virus, so antibiotics do not work.

patterns: Are antibiotics effective in preventing or treating the covid
am i supposed to take medicines
responses: Antibiotics should not be used as a means of prevention or treatment of covid. They should only be used as directed by a physician to treat a bacterial infection.

patterns: Are there any medicines or therapies that can prevent or cure covid
how to get rid of symptoms
responses: While some western, traditional or home remedies may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms of covid, there is no evidence that current medicine can prevent or cure the disease.

patterns: Are there any medicines or therapies that can prevent or cure covid
will therapy help to get over covid
responses: WHO does not recommend self-medication with any medicines, including antibiotics, as a prevention or cure for covid.

patterns: Is there a vaccine, drug or treatment for covid
responses: Not yet. To date, there is no vaccine and no specific antiviral medicine to prevent or treat covid-2019.

patterns: Is there a vaccine, drug or treatment for covid
responses: Those affected should receive care to relieve symptoms. People with serious illness should be hospitalized. Most patients recover thanks to supportive care.

patterns: Is there a vaccine, drug or treatment for covid
responses: Possible vaccines and some specific drug treatments are under investigation. They are being tested through clinical trials. WHO is coordinating efforts to develop vaccines and medicines to prevent and treat covid.

patterns: Is there a vaccine, drug or treatment for covid
responses: The most effective ways to protect yourself and others against covid are to frequently clean your hands, cover your cough with the bend of elbow or tissue, and maintain a distance of at least 1 meter (3 feet) from people who are coughing or sneezing.

patterns: Is covid the same as SARS
what is difference between covid and sars
responses: No. The virus that causes covid and the one that caused the outbreak of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) in 2003 are related to each other genetically, but the diseases they cause are quite different.

patterns: Is covid the same as SARS
responses: SARS was more deadly but much less infectious than covid. There have been no outbreaks of SARS anywhere in the world since 2003.

patterns: Should I wear a mask to protect myself
will mask protect us from covid
do masks protext us from covid
responses: Only wear a mask if you are ill with covid symptoms (especially coughing) or looking after someone who may have covid. Disposable face mask can only be used once.

patterns: Should I wear a mask to protect myself
should i wear mask if im positive
should i wear mask if im negative
responses: If you are not ill or looking after someone who is ill then you are wasting a mask.

patterns: Should I wear a mask to protect myself
responses: There is a world-wide shortage of masks, so WHO urges people to use masks wisely.

patterns: How to put on, use, take off and dispose of a mask
responses: Remember, a mask should only be used by health workers, care takers, and individuals with respiratory symptoms, such as fever and cough.

patterns: How to put on, use, take off and dispose of a mask
responses: Before touching the mask, clean hands with an alcohol-based hand rub or soap and water

patterns: How long is the incubation period for covid
how long do we need to quarantine
how long do we stay in lockdown
if we positive how long should we stay at home
responses: The “incubation period” means the time between catching the virus and beginning to have symptoms of the disease.

patterns: How long is the incubation period for covid
how long is quarantine period for covid
responses: Most estimates of the incubation period for covid range from 1-14 days, most commonly around five days. These estimates will be updated as more data become available.

patterns: Can humans be infected with the covid from an animal source
can we get infected from animals
responses: Coronaviruses are a large family of viruses that are common in animals. Occasionally, people get infected with these viruses which may then spread to other people.

patterns: Can humans be infected with the covid from an animal source
can we get covid from animal source
responses: SARS-CoV was associated with civet cats and MERS-CoV is transmitted by dromedary camels.

patterns: Can humans be infected with the covid from an animal source
responses: Possible animal sources of covid have not yet been confirmed.

patterns: Can humans be infected with the covid from an animal source
responses: To protect yourself, such as when visiting live animal markets, avoid direct contact with animals and surfaces in contact with animals.

patterns: Can humans be infected with the covid from an animal source
can covid come from animal source
can covid be caught by animals
responses: Handle raw meat, milk or animal organs with care to avoid contamination of uncooked foods and avoid consuming raw or undercooked animal products.

patterns: Can I catch covid from my pet
can i get covid from pet
if pet has covid can i get it
if pet has covid can i get infected
will i get infected if my pet has covid
can my pet give me covid
responses: While there has been one instance of a dog being infected in Hong Kong, to date, there is no evidence that a dog, cat or any pet can transmit covid.

patterns: Can I catch covid from my pet
responses: covid is mainly spread through droplets produced when an infected person coughs, sneezes, or speaks.

patterns: How long does the virus survive on surfaces
how long covid stay on surface
responses: It is not certain how long the virus that causes covid survives on surfaces, but it seems to behave like other coronaviruses.

patterns: How long does the virus survive on surfaces
will covid stay on surface for long
responses: Studies suggest that coronaviruses (including preliminary information on the covid virus) may persist on surfaces for a few hours or up to several days. This may vary under different conditions (e.g. type of surface, temperature or humidity of the environment).

patterns: How long does the virus survive on surfaces
responses: If you think a surface may be infected, clean it with simple disinfectant to kill the virus and protect yourself and others.

patterns: Is it safe to receive a package from any area where covid has been reported
can we take parcel from covid positive person
can we get covid from delivery boy
is it unsafe to order online during covid
is it unsafe to order online
can we get covid through parcel
responses: Yes. The likelihood of an infected person contaminating commercial goods is low and the risk of catching the virus that causes covid from a package that has been moved, travelled, and exposed to different conditions and temperature is also low.

patterns: Is the source causing covid known
responses: Currently, the source of SARS-CoV-2, the coronavirus (CoV) causing covid is unknown.

patterns: How did the first human SARS-CoV-2 infections occur

The first known infections from SARS-CoV-2 were discovered in Wuhan, China. The original source of viral transmission to humans remains unclear, as does whether the virus became pathogenic before or after the spillover event.
responses: The first human cases of covid were identified in Wuhan City, China in December 2019.

patterns: How did the first human SARS-CoV-2 infections occur
responses: SARS-CoV, the virus which caused the SARS outbreak in 2003, jumped from an animal reservoir (civet cats, a farmed wild animal) to humans and then spread between humans.

patterns: How did the first human SARS-CoV-2 infections occur
responses: Until the source of this virus is identified and controlled, there is a risk of reintroduction of the virus in the human population and the risk of new outbreaks like the ones we are currently experiencing.
covid spreads in crowded places and closed confined places

The virus that causes covid is mainly transmitted through droplets generated when an infected person coughs, sneezes, or speaks. These droplets are too heavy to hang in the air. They quickly fall on floors or surfaces.

patterns: Are pregnant women at higher risk from covid
will pregnant women catch virus faster
will pregnant women catch covid faster
responses: At present there is no evidence that they are at higher risk of severe illness than the general population.

patterns: Are pregnant women at higher risk from covid
why do pregnant women catch covid fast
why do pregnant women catch covid
responses: due to changes in their bodies and immune systems, we know that pregnant women can be badly affected by some respiratory infections. It is therefore important that they take precautions to protect themselves against covid, and report possible symptoms (including fever, cough or difficulty breathing) to their healthcare provider.

patterns: I'm pregnant. How can I protect myself against covid
responses: Pregnant women should take the same precautions to avoid covid infection as other people.

patterns: I'm pregnant. How can I protect myself against covid
how to prevent covid in pregnancy
responses: Pregnant women and women who have recently delivered – including those affected by covid - should attend their routine care appointments.

patterns: Should pregnant women be tested for covid
is it safe to test for covid when pregnant
is it safe to test when pregnant
responses: Testing protocols and eligibility vary depending on where you live.

patterns: Can covid be passed from a woman to her unborn baby
can covid happen to unborn baby
responses: We still do not know if a pregnant woman with covid can pass the virus to her foetus or baby during pregnancy or delivery. To date, the virus has not been found in samples of amniotic fluid or breastmilk.

patterns: What care should be available during pregnancy and childbirth
responses: All pregnant women, including those with confirmed or suspected covid infections, have the right to high quality care before, during and after childbirth.

patterns: Do pregnant women with suspected or confirmed covid need to give birth by ceasarean section
responses: No. WHO advice is that caesarean sections should only be performed when medically justified.
Yes. Women with covid can breastfeed if they wish to do so.

patterns: Can I touch and hold my newborn baby if I have covid
can covid spread to newborn baby
will baby get covid if i touch
responses: Yes. Close contact and early, exclusive breastfeeding helps a baby to thrive.

patterns: How are covid and influenza viruses similar
responses: covid and influenza viruses have a similar disease presentation. That is, they both cause respiratory disease, which presents as a wide range of illness from asymptomatic or mild through to severe disease and death.

patterns: How are covid and influenza viruses similar
responses: Both viruses are transmitted by contact, droplets and fomites.

patterns: How are covid and influenza viruses different
responses: The speed of transmission is an important point of difference between the two viruses. Influenza has a shorter median incubation period (the time from infection to appearance of symptoms) and a shorter serial interval (the time between successive cases) than covid virus.

patterns: How are covid and influenza viruses different
responses: Those most at risk for severe influenza infection are children, pregnant women, elderly, those with underlying chronic medical conditions and those who are immunosuppressed.

patterns: How are covid and influenza viruses different
responses: Mortality for covid appears higher than for influenza, especially seasonal influenza.

patterns: What medical interventions are available for covid and influenza viruses
responses: While there are a number of therapeutics currently in clinical trials in China and more than 20 vaccines in development for covid, there are currently no licensed vaccines or therapeutics for covid.

patterns: Are smokers and tobacco users at higher risk of covid infection
responses: Smokers are likely to be more vulnerable to covid as the act of smoking means that fingers (and possibly contaminated cigarettes) are in contact with lips which increases the possibility of transmission of virus from hand to mouth.

patterns: Are smokers and tobacco users at higher risk of covid infection
responses: Smoking products such as water pipes often involve the sharing of mouth pieces and hoses, which could facilitate the transmission of covid in communal and social settings.

patterns: How large does a meeting or event need to be in order to be a mass gathering
how many people are in mass gathering
responses: High profile international sporting events such as the Olympics or World Cups as well as international religious events such as the Hajj count as mass gatherings.

patterns: How large does a meeting or event need to be in order to be a mass gathering
responses: An event counts as a mass gatherings if the number of people it brings together is so large that it has the potential to strain the planning and response resources of the health system in the community where it takes place.

patterns: Does WHO recommend that all international mass gatherings be cancelled because of covid
should we not meet many people
responses: No. As each international mass gathering is different, the factors to consider when determining if the event should be cancelled may also differ.
